full_summary:
# Pre-Qualified Artwork Inventory for Outdoor Exhibits and Major Events in Canada's Capital Region
=============================================

## Notice of Tender

The Department of Canadian Heritage (PCH) invites professional Canadian artists to participate in the development of a pre-qualified artwork inventory for outdoor exhibits and major events in Canada's Capital Region.

### Description of Requirement

PCH is seeking large-scale outdoor artworks, including interactive and light installations, to enrich the visitor experience in downtown Ottawa and Gatineau. The selected artworks will be showcased in highly visible locations and may be used for exhibitions at major events such as Canada Day or Winterlude, or displayed at various locations in the National Capital Region for longer-term exhibitions.

### Evaluation Process and Selection Criteria

*   Artists will be assessed based on the entire requirement of the call for proposals, which includes mandatory and rated requirements.
*   An evaluation team will select artworks to be pre-qualified for the inventory.
*   The final choice, number, programming, and placement of artworks will be at the discretion of PCH.

### Basis of Selection

To be declared responsive, a proposal must:

*   Comply with all the requirements of the call for proposals
*   Meet all mandatory requirements
*   Meet the minimum required score for each point-rated criterion

### Submission of Proposals

If you are interested in participating, please submit your proposal electronically to [artpublic-publicart@pch.gc.ca](mailto:artpublic-publicart@pch.gc.ca) by the specified deadline. Only electronic proposals will be accepted.

### Important Notes

*   All contracts are subject to PCH's internal approvals process, which includes a requirement to approve funding for any proposed contract.
*   Non-responsive proposals will not be evaluated.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Stephanie Dupel at [contrats-contracting@pch.gc.ca](mailto:contrats-contracting@pch.gc.ca) or (000) 000-0000.
